sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail

name: sail
trans: 航行，扬帆 (vi.), 帆布，风帆 (noun)

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

sentences.chinese: 六名英国海员溺水身亡。

sentences.english: We were both experienced sailors.
sentences.chinese: 我们两个都是经验丰富的水手。

sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克

sentences.english: Statues of saints lined the walls of the church.

detailed_translations.english: someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .

sentences.chinese: 你的意大利面要配些色拉吗？

sentences.chinese: 菠菜色拉

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of raw vegetables, especially  lettuce  ,  cucumber  , and tomato

sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

sentences.english: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
sentences.chinese: 那两名士兵向塞西尔中尉行了礼。

an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer

sentences.english: The church's message of salvation has changed the lives of many.
sentences.chinese: 这个教会的灵魂得救的训诫已经改变了很多人的一生。

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号

sentences.chinese: 肯在工作中出了事故，不得不去医院。

sentences.chinese: 在这件事情上我同他是一致的。

sentences.chinese: 如果您想谋求个人事业、理想与公司的事业和理想高度一致，如果您追求的是志同道合的工作愉悦，请加入我们！

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.

sentences.english: sulphuric acid

sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

sentences.chinese: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。

name: bark
trans: 树皮，树干外层 (noun), 叫唤，吠叫 (vi.)

sentences.chinese: 在芬兰，纯化论者坚持说只能加白桦树皮。

sentences.chinese: 软木橡树的树皮与这些地方的百姓生活密切地交织在一起。

sentences.english: In his workshop, a Kakunodate craftsman prepares the cherry bark before applying this as a veneer to a range of objects.
sentences.chinese: 在将这种工艺作为一系列物体的单板运用之前，角馆的工匠在自己的作坊准备樱花树皮。

sentences.chinese: 谷仓里堆满了粮食。

sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒是用橡木酒桶放陈的。

sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，地面还是一片荒漠。

sentences.chinese: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The favorite, of course, is camel.
sentences.chinese: 最受欢迎的自然是驼色。

sentences.chinese: 大地色无疑是这一季的主打，驼色也非常适合“王室风范”“大都市遭遇乡村风尚”这些流行系列，并且配合得天衣无缝。

sentences.chinese: 我们回营地吧，天快黑了。

sentences.chinese: 埃伦•威尔逊湖边的营地

sentences.english: The soldiers broke camp (= took down their tents etc ) and left before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在黎明前拔营出发了。

sentences.english: We set up camp (= made the camping place ready ) at nearby Icicle Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们在附近的冰柱湖边建了营地。

sentences.english: The expedition’s base camp (= main camp ) was 6,000 feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 探险队的大本营在山峰下面6,000英尺处。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people stay in tents, shelters etc for a short time, usually in the mountains, a forest etc
to set up a tent or shelter and stay there for a short time

sentences.english: a beautiful campus in New England
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰的一个美丽校园

detailed_translations.english: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live

sentences.english: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced, or otherwise processed.
sentences.chinese: …将要经过装罐、去皮、切块或其他加工程序的水果和蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

sentences.english: ...a woollen cape.
sentences.chinese: …一件羊毛披肩。

sentences.english: Cape Cod
sentences.chinese: 科德角

detailed_translations.english: a long loose piece of clothing without sleeves that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

sentences.chinese: 机长和全体机组人员欢迎各位乘坐本次航班。

sentences.english: He captained the winning team in 1991.
sentences.chinese: 他于1991年率队夺得胜利。

detailed_translations.english: the sailor in charge of a ship, or the pilot in charge of an aircraft

sentences.english: Around one third of our meals should be based on carbohydrate, with roughly one half of these grains being whole.
sentences.chinese: 我们每餐食物应当差不多有三分之一是碳水化合物，大概有一半谷物食品为全麦的。

sentences.english: There have been no studies of the effects of a low carbohydrate diet on pregnancy, so its effect on the fetus, if any, are unknown.
sentences.chinese: 目前为止还没有关于怀孕时低碳水化合物饮食影响的研究，因此如果对胎儿有什么影响也是不知道的。

sentences.english: The reason for this is that carbohydrate consumption stimulates insulin production, which aids the production of muscle glycogen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为是碳水化合物的消耗刺激了胰岛素的分泌，后者对于肌肉糖原产生有帮助。

sentences.english: I dread to think what the carbon footprint must be like of moving that coal but we have no choice.
sentences.chinese: 我都不敢想象为了运这些煤产生了多少碳足迹，但我们没有选择。

sentences.english: By removing whales, sharks and large fish, we ve reduced the amount of carbon stored in these populations.
sentences.chinese: 由于猎杀鲸鱼，鲨鱼和大型鱼类，我们也就减少了碳在这些物种群的储存量。

sentences.english: Across the world, forests and the soil beneath them absorb about a quarter of all carbon emissions.
sentences.chinese: 纵观全球，森林与它们脚下的土壤能吸收大约碳排放总量的四分之一。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that exists in a pure form as diamonds,  graphite  etc, or in an impure form as coal, petrol etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol C

sentences.english: Having clean hands is one of the cardinal rules when preparing food.
sentences.chinese: 双手洁净是准备食物时的一项最基本要求。

sentences.english: an issue of cardinal importance
sentences.chinese: 至关重要的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 红衣主教；枢机主教；鲜红色；【鸟类】(北美)主红雀
detailed_translations.english: a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，基本的；深红色的
detailed_translations.english: very important or basic

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

sentences.english: The president-elect followed in an open carriage drawn by six beautiful grey horses.
sentences.chinese: 新当选的总统紧随其后，坐着6匹灰色骏马开道的敞篷马车。

sentences.english: a railway carriage
sentences.chinese: 铁路客车厢

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with wheels that is pulled by a horse, used in the past

sentences.english: a baby carrier
sentences.chinese: 婴儿背带

detailed_translations.english: something used for carrying something

sentences.english: The morning paper carried a story about demonstrations in New York and Washington D.C.
sentences.chinese: 晨报登载了纽约和华盛顿特区举行示威游行的报道。

sentences.english: The national TV network carries religious programmes.
sentences.chinese: 全国电视网播出宗教节目。

detailed_translations.english: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it

sentences.english: grated carrots

sentences.english: I’ve never missed a day’s work through illness.
sentences.chinese: 我从未因病耽误过一天工作。

sentences.english: ways to improve your health and reduce the risk of illness
sentences.chinese: 增进健康减少疾病的方法

detailed_translations.english: a disease of the body or mind, or the condition of being ill

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

sentences.english: As she listened, she played an imaginary piano on her knees.
sentences.chinese: 她边听边在膝盖上作弹钢琴状。

sentences.english: We must protect older people from harm, whether it is real or imaginary.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保护老人免受伤害，无论这伤害是真实的还是假想的。

detailed_translations.english: not real, but produced from pictures or ideas in your mind

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

sentences.english: an imaginative use of computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的妙用

sentences.english: children’s imaginative play
sentences.chinese: 儿童富有想象力的游戏

sentences.english: an imaginative solution to the litter problem
sentences.chinese: 解决乱扔垃圾的问题的有创意的方法

detailed_translations.english: containing new and interesting ideas

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

sentences.english: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
sentences.chinese: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。

sentences.english: the leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 主要的工业国

sentences.english: a leading heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 最好的心脏病专家

sentences.english: leading members of the government
sentences.chinese: 政府要员

detailed_translations.english: best, most important, or most successful

sentences.english: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。

sentences.english: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.english: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。

sentences.english: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
sentences.chinese: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

detailed_translations.english: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

sentences.english: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
sentences.chinese: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

sentences.english: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。

detailed_translations.english: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
flat and not sloping in any direction

sentences.english: Pull this lever to open the gate.
sentences.chinese: 拉此横杆开启大门。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of metal that you use to lift something heavy by putting one end under the object and pushing the other end down
to move something with a lever

sentences.english: ...an annual levy on all drivers.
sentences.chinese: …向所有司机征收的年税。

sentences.english: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
sentences.chinese: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

detailed_translations.english: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

sentences.english: a lack of management skills
sentences.chinese: 缺乏管理技巧

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 一个管理顾问

sentences.english: management training courses
sentences.chinese: 管理培训课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理； 处理； 管理部门， 管理人员
detailed_translations.english: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

sentences.english: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
sentences.chinese: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作
detailed_translations.english: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
to give someone the right or power to do something

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

sentences.english: He felt some guilt over the manner of her death.
sentences.chinese: 她以这种方式死去，他心里有些内疚。

sentences.english: The issue will be resolved in a manner that is fair to both sides.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将用对双方都公平的方式来解决。

sentences.english: criticism of the manner in which the bishop was appointed
sentences.chinese: 对主教任命方式的批评

sentences.english: She has a calm relaxed manner.
sentences.chinese: 她举止镇定而从容。

sentences.english: Her children all had such good manners.
sentences.chinese: 她的孩子都很有礼貌。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is done or happens

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

sentences.english: marginal groups in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes
sentences.chinese: 边注（旁注）

detailed_translations.english: not part of a main or important group or situation

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

sentences.english: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.chinese: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.english: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

sentences.english: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.english: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.chinese: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.english: In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.chinese: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
to commit a crime or crimes

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

sentences.english: the opening paragraphs of the novel
sentences.chinese: 小说开篇的几个段落

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

sentences.english: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

sentences.english: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
sentences.chinese: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

sentences.english: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。

sentences.english: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。

sentences.english: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
sentences.chinese: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作，部分原因是母亲病了。

sentences.english: The group is funded partly by the government.
sentences.chinese: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

detailed_translations.english: to some degree, but not completely

sentences.english: Discuss your worries with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 和伴侣谈谈你的忧虑。

sentences.english: Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners .
sentences.chinese: 只有29%的单身家长得到他们前配偶的经济资助。

sentences.english: Clare’s my tennis partner.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔是我的网球搭档。

sentences.english: Take your partners for the next dance.
sentences.chinese: 挑选下一支舞的舞伴吧。

detailed_translations.english: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

sentences.english: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
sentences.chinese: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。

sentences.english: It’s probably quicker by train.
sentences.chinese: 乘火车可能会快一点。

sentences.english: Have we got time for a quick drink?
sentences.chinese: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？

sentences.english: What’s the quickest way to the station?
sentences.chinese: 到车站怎么走最快？

sentences.english: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
sentences.chinese: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。

sentences.english: Three bombs went off in quick succession (= quickly, one after the other ).

to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

sentences.chinese: 我真希望那时我就知道现在所知道的一切。

name: elsewhere

sentences.chinese: 只有冰水才能让我真正解渴。

sentences.chinese: 一年里心脏病发作了两次，可是那也没让他把烟戒掉。

sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: widespread
trans: 广泛的， 广泛分布的 (adj.)

sentences.english: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

sentences.english: Who’s winning (= who is most successful at this point in the game )?
sentences.chinese: 现在谁领先？

detailed_translations.english: to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
a success or victory, especially in sport

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: witness
trans: 目击者， 见证人 (noun), 见证 (vt.)

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: incidentally
trans: 顺便提到， 不经意间 (adv.)

sentences.english: Incidentally, where were you born?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

sentences.english: The wine, incidentally, goes very well with a mature cheese.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说一下，这种葡萄酒配熟干酪味道很好。

detailed_translations.english: used to add more information to what you have just said, or to introduce a new subject that you have just thought of

name: incline
trans: 倾斜， 倾斜 (vi., vt.), 倾向于 (vi.)

sentences.english: a steep incline
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

sentences.english: measures to accelerate the rate of economic growth
sentences.chinese: 加快经济增长速度的措施

detailed_translations.english: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

sentences.english: He wrote a letter of acceptance (=  a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc  ) to the university.
sentences.chinese: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接受， 承认； 容忍
detailed_translations.english: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

sentences.english: As everybody’s here, let’s begin.
sentences.chinese: 大家都到齐了，我们就开始吧。

sentences.english: In the third year students begin the study of classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 学生在三年级开始学古代汉语。

sentences.english: The president begins talks with the prime minister tonight.
sentences.chinese: 总统将于今晚和首相展开会谈。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something
to start doing something

sentences.english: There’s a short poem at the beginning of every chapter.
sentences.chinese: 每一章的开头都有一首短诗。

sentences.english: From the beginning of my career as a journalist, I’ve been writing about gender issues.
sentences.chinese: 从我一开始干记者这一行，我就写性别议题的题材。

sentences.english: I thought he loved me; perhaps he did in the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 我以为他爱我，也许开始时他确实是爱我的。

sentences.english: That chance meeting marked the beginning of a long and happy relationship.
sentences.chinese: 那次邂逅展开了一段长久而幸福的关系。

sentences.english: This is just the beginning of a new and different life for you.
sentences.chinese: 这只是你新的别样生活的开始。

sentences.english: I said he would cause trouble, right from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就说过，他会惹事。

sentences.english: I opposed it from the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我一开始就反对。

sentences.english: The whole trip was a disaster from beginning to end.
sentences.chinese: 旅途从头到尾都在出乱子。

sentences.english: I think I have the beginnings of a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉要感冒了。

sentences.english: He rose from humble beginnings to great wealth.
sentences.chinese: 他出身卑微，如今已腰缠万贯。

detailed_translations.english: the start or first part of an event, story, period of time etc

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

detailed_translations.chinese: 行为， 举止， 表现

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

sentences.english: You shouldn’t believe everything you read.
sentences.chinese: 你不应尽信书上看来的东西。

sentences.english: I believed him, even though his story sounded unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 我相信了他，尽管他的话听上去难以置信。

sentences.english: I don’t believe a word of it (=  I think it is completely untrue  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我一句话也不相信。

sentences.english: Did you honestly believe that I’d be stupid enough to do that?
sentences.chinese: 你真的认为我会傻到做那样的事情吗？。

detailed_translations.english: to be sure that something is true or that someone is telling the truth

sentences.english: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子属于她家已有三四代了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置
detailed_translations.english: If something belongs to you, you own it

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

sentences.english: A benevolent uncle paid for her to have music lessons.
sentences.chinese: 一位叔叔慷慨解囊，出钱供她上音乐课。

sentences.english: a benevolent smile
sentences.chinese: 慈祥的笑容

detailed_translations.english: kind and generous

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

sentences.english: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.english: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.english: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.english: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.chinese: 她生还的可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: deliberate
trans: 仔细考虑， 慎重行事 (vi.)

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

sentences.english: The morning mail has just been delivered.
sentences.chinese: 早晨的邮件刚送到。

sentences.english: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你们送货吗？

sentences.english: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

detailed_translations.english: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

sentences.english: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。

sentences.english: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。

sentences.english: fresh milk deliveries
sentences.chinese: 新鲜牛奶递送

sentences.english: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought

sentences.english: romantic fiction
sentences.chinese: 爱情小说

sentences.english: historical fiction
sentences.chinese: 历史小说

sentences.english: For years he managed to keep up the fiction that he was not married.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他设法一直给人一种未婚的假象。

detailed_translations.english: books and stories about imaginary people and events

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

sentences.english: Neither country is capable of fighting a long war .
sentences.chinese: 两个国家都没有能力打持久战。

sentences.english: Later the Indians fought the Anglo settlers.
sentences.chinese: 后来，印第安人跟英国殖民者打起了仗。

sentences.english: She fought her way back into the first team.
sentences.chinese: 她奋力拼搏，又回到了第一团队。

sentences.english: The men were fighting for higher wages.
sentences.chinese: 那些人在争取加薪。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in a war or battle

name: figure
trans: 数字， 数字 (noun), 出现， 出场 (vi.)

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

detailed_translations.chinese: 财政，金融；财源，财务情况
detailed_translations.english: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
sentences.chinese: 山顶的终年积雪

detailed_translations.english: permanent

sentences.english: Shea’s symptoms perplexed the doctors.
sentences.chinese: 谢伊的症状令医生们困惑。

detailed_translations.english: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: optimum conditions for growth
sentences.chinese: 最适宜生长的条件

sentences.english: This design makes the optimum use of the available space.
sentences.chinese: 这一设计最大限度地利用了现有的空间。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: rake
trans: 耙子，扫帚 (noun), 收集，整理 (vt.)

sentences.english: The searchlight raked the open ground around the prison.
sentences.chinese: 探照灯在监狱周围的空地上来回扫射。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜索；用耙子耙；掠过，擦过
detailed_translations.english: to move a rake across a surface in order to make the soil level, gather dead leaves etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 耙子；斜度；钱耙；放荡的人，浪子
detailed_translations.english: a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

sentences.english: Yeah, , now you know how the sex ratio matters!
sentences.chinese: 是的，现在你知道性别比例的问题了吧！ ！

sentences.english: The ratio could reach one in four within a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年之内这个比例可以达到四分之一。

sentences.english: When using profiling it is typical to consider only the ratio (or percentage) of time spent in certain areas.
sentences.chinese: 当使用分析时，它是典型的考虑时间花费在某些领域的比例（或百分比）。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

sentences.english: Keep the questions in the same serial order .
sentences.chinese: 让这些问题保持原来的顺序。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的；连载的；分期偿还的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order

detailed_translations.chinese: 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说
detailed_translations.english: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

sentences.english: I had a piece of toast for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我早饭吃了一片吐司。

sentences.english: I toasted the cheese sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 我烤了干酪三明治。

detailed_translations.english: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft
to make bread or other food brown by placing it close to heat

sentences.english: We’ve very much enjoyed working together .
sentences.chinese: 我们在一起工作非常开心。

sentences.english: They’ve decided to spend more time together.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定要花更多时间在一起。

sentences.english: He and my father were at school together.
sentences.chinese: 他和我父亲一起上过学。

sentences.english: Together they went back inside the villa.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起回到了别墅里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一起；同时；相互；连续地；总共
detailed_translations.english: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的；情绪稳定的，做事有效率的

sentences.english: slot-machine tokens
sentences.chinese: 自动贩卖机使用的代用币

sentences.english: Please accept this gift as a small token of our appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 区区薄礼，略表谢意，还请笑纳。

detailed_translations.english: a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines

sentences.english: ...his tolerance and understanding of diverse human nature.
sentences.chinese: …他对各种人性的宽容和理解。

detailed_translations.english: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

sentences.english: Everybody cheered when the firemen arrived.
sentences.chinese: 消防员到达时，大家都欢呼起来。

sentences.english: The audience was shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 观众在呐喊欢呼。

sentences.english: The spectators cheered him wildly.
sentences.chinese: 观众拼命为他加油。

detailed_translations.english: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事
detailed_translations.english: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

sentences.english: the chemical composition of bleach
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂的化学成分

sentences.english: a chemical analysis of the soil
sentences.chinese: 对土壤的化学分析

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances
relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

sentences.english: In marriage, a man promises to cherish his wife.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，男人承诺要爱护妻子。

sentences.english: his most cherished possession
sentences.chinese: 他最珍爱的物品

detailed_translations.english: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

sentences.english: the age of the silicon chip
sentences.chinese: 芯片时代

sentences.english: chip technology
sentences.chinese: 芯片技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 屑片， 碎片； 炸土豆条； 集成电路片， 集成块； 缺口， 瑕疵
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of  silicon  that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and  process  information in computers

sentences.english: I think London was a good choice as a venue.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得伦敦是个很好的选址。

sentences.english: choice steak
sentences.chinese: 上等牛排

detailed_translations.english: the person or thing that someone chooses
(especially of food) of very good quality

sentences.english: It took us ages to choose a new carpet.
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选新地毯花了很长时间。

sentences.english: A panel of judges will choose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 会由一个评判小组选出冠军。

sentences.english: He chose his words carefully as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时字斟句酌。

sentences.english: You can, if you choose, invest in the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以投资股票市场。

detailed_translations.english: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

sentences.english: a board meeting
