sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

sentences.english: Smoking is my only vice.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是我唯一的恶习。

detailed_translations.english: a bad habit

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

sentences.english: The door clicked shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 门在我身后咔嗒一声关上了。

sentences.english: Mother clicked her tongue (= made a short sound to show disapproval ) and sighed.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈咂咂嘴，叹了口气。

sentences.english: Edmund clicked his fingers (= made a short sound to get someone’s attention ) for John to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙弹了个响指示意约翰跟着他。

sentences.english: Vogel clicked his heels (= hit the heels of his shoes together ) and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 沃格尔咔嗒一声并拢脚跟，鞠了个躬。

sentences.english: Twist the lever and the gears click into place .
sentences.chinese: 转动变速杆，排挡就咔嗒一声到位了。

sentences.english: You can check your e-mail with a click of your mouse.
sentences.chinese: 通过鼠标的一点你就能查电子邮件。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound
Click is also a noun

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.english: She closed the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.english: Let me do the car door – it won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.english: Beth closed her eyes and tried to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

detailed_translations.english: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

sentences.english: a closet full of beautiful clothes
sentences.chinese: 满是漂亮衣服的壁橱

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间
detailed_translations.english: a cupboard built into the wall of a room from the floor to the ceiling
to shut someone in a room away from other people in order to discuss something private, to be alone etc

sentences.english: The spy sent his message in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个间谍用密码发送情报。

sentences.english: But we have not yet implemented this in the code.
sentences.chinese: 但我们在代码中尚未实现此功能。

sentences.english: The hacker came smack up against the company's policy of keeping its records in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个计算机黑客突然碰壁了，因这家公司实行了用密码保存公司纪录的政策。

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

sentences.english: We oppose racism in all its forms.
sentences.chinese: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

sentences.english: The female form is a thing of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 女性形体是一种美。

sentences.english: The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。

detailed_translations.english: the way something is or appears to be
to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process

sentences.english: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.chinese: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.english: a formal agreement between the countries
sentences.chinese: 两国间的正式协议

sentences.english: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.chinese: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

detailed_translations.english: made or done officially or publicly

sentences.english: The courses were run to a consistent format.
sentences.chinese: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计，安排；格式，样式，版式
detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged
to organize the space on a computer  disk  so that information can be stored on it

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

sentences.english: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在寻找和平方案。

sentences.english: There is no magic formula (= a method that is certain to be successful ) that will transform sorrow into happiness.
sentences.chinese: 没有妙方可以化悲为喜。

sentences.english: With viewing figures up a million, the programme has a winning formula .
sentences.chinese: 收视人数增加了一百万，这个节目的确拥有吸引观众的法宝。

sentences.english: the formula for calculating distance
sentences.chinese: 计算距离的公式

detailed_translations.english: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

sentences.english: a tour guide
sentences.chinese: 导游

sentences.english: an experienced mountain guide
sentences.chinese: 一位有经验的登山向导

sentences.english: We were guided around the museums.
sentences.chinese: 我们在导游的带领下参观了博物馆。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to take tourists to a place and show them around
to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

sentences.english: the Women’s Guild
sentences.chinese: 妇女协会

detailed_translations.english: an organization of people who do the same job or have the same interests

sentences.english: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 出于内疚，他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

sentences.english: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
sentences.chinese: 他想到自己那样对待她，心里非常歉疚。

sentences.english: He did not deny his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 他没有否认自己有罪。

sentences.english: His guilt was proved beyond all doubt by the prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他的罪行已被原告方证实确凿无疑。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

sentences.english: She looked self-conscious and guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去很不自然，很内疚的样子。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty of the death of PC Jones.
sentences.chinese: 关于警员琼斯的死，他被判无罪。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

sentences.english: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再加一百元钱，我想他会卖的。

sentences.english: He regrets selling all his old records.
sentences.chinese: 他后悔把所有的老唱片都卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone in exchange for money

sentences.english: Lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 琳恩寄了几张婚礼照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: [sent-sent] 送， 寄； 派遣， 打发； 发送； 发射
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to notice or recognize a particular smell
the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

sentences.english: Soak the clothes in cold water.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。

sentences.english: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
sentences.chinese: 把锅泡着吧，我过一会儿再洗。

detailed_translations.english: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

sentences.english: social issues, such as unemployment and education
sentences.chinese: 失业和教育之类的社会问题

sentences.english: the country’s serious social problems
sentences.chinese: 该国严重的社会问题

sentences.english: a challenge to the social order
sentences.chinese: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

detailed_translations.chinese: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
detailed_translations.english: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

sentences.english: They declared for socialism.
sentences.chinese: 他们表示拥护社会主义。

sentences.english: We should rally under the banner of socialism.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当在社会主义的旗帜下团结起来。

sentences.english: From the Left: Yes! Yes, exactly what socialism is.
sentences.chinese: 从左边的回答：是的，这就是社会主义。

detailed_translations.english: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

sentences.english: soluble aspirin
sentences.chinese: 可溶性阿司匹林

detailed_translations.english: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

sentences.english: The best solution would be for them to separate.
sentences.chinese: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

sentences.english: he solution of glucose in water
sentences.chinese: 葡萄糖在水中的溶解

detailed_translations.english: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

sentences.english: Lee bent and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

detailed_translations.english: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
to become curved and no longer flat or straight
a curved part of something, especially a road or river

sentences.english: The top layer should now point down to the layer beneath.
sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.english: The fortress on the hill covered the harbour area beneath.
sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

detailed_translations.english: in or to a lower position than something, or directly under something

sentences.english: Wendy came up and sat beside me.

sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

sentences.english: the wealthy nations of the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上的富国

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of money, possessions etc

sentences.english: They all had sticks which they planned to use as weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们都持有棍棒，打算当武器用。

detailed_translations.english: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun

sentences.english: hand-woven scarves
sentences.chinese: 手织围巾

sentences.english: Only a few of the women still weave.
sentences.chinese: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。

sentences.english: traditional basket weaving
sentences.chinese: 传统的编篮技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回行进；编织；编造，编纂
detailed_translations.english: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this

sentences.english: a web of streets
sentences.chinese: 纵横交错的街道

sentences.english: We were caught in a tangled web of relationships.
sentences.chinese: 我们陷入了错综复杂的人际关系网络。

detailed_translations.english: a complicated pattern of things that are closely connected to each other

sentences.english: He hammered the wedge into the crack in the stone.
sentences.chinese: 他用锤子把楔子砸入石缝里。

sentences.english: The phone was wedged under his chin.
sentences.chinese: 电话夹在他下巴下面。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood
to force something firmly into a narrow space

sentences.english: the Amazon jungle
sentences.chinese: 亚马孙丛林

detailed_translations.english: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

sentences.english: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
sentences.chinese: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口

sentences.english: Junction 5 on the M40
sentences.chinese: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

detailed_translations.english: a place where one road, track etc joins another

sentences.english: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
sentences.chinese: 她现在和比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

detailed_translations.english: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

sentences.english: This cupboard’s full of junk.
sentences.chinese: 这个壁橱里塞满了杂物。

detailed_translations.english: old or unwanted objects that have no use or value
to get rid of something because it is old or useless

sentences.english: Unload everything from the boat and clean it thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 从小船上卸下所有的货物并彻底地清洗。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc
to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

sentences.english: Katie was still awake, sitting bolt upright(= sitting with her back very straight ) staring at the television.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂还醒着，坐得笔直，眼睛盯着电视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正直的，诚实的；垂直的，直立的；笔直的；合乎正道的
detailed_translations.english: standing or sitting straight up
a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something

sentences.english: I went upstairs and had a shower.
sentences.chinese: 我上楼冲了个澡。

sentences.english: She’s upstairs in bed feeling ill.
sentences.chinese: 她身体不舒服，在楼上躺着。

sentences.english: Marsani moved into the upstairs apartment.
sentences.chinese: 玛萨妮搬进了楼上的公寓。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在楼上，向楼上；上楼；往楼上
detailed_translations.english: towards or on an upper floor in a building
An upstairs room or object is situated on a floor of a building that is higher than the ground floor
one or all of the upper floors in a building

sentences.english: upward pressure on bank interest rates
sentences.chinese: 针对银行利率的越来越大的压力

sentences.english: They climbed upward along the steep cliffs surrounding the village.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着环绕村庄的陡峭悬崖向上爬。

sentences.english: 'There,' said Jack, pointing upwards.
sentences.chinese: “那儿，”杰克往上指着说。

detailed_translations.english: increasing to a higher level
If someone moves or looks upward, they move or look up towards a higher place

sentences.english: a brisk walk
sentences.chinese: 轻快的行走

sentences.english: They set off at a brisk pace .
sentences.chinese: 他们踏着轻快的步伐上路了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的， 生气勃勃的； 兴隆的， 繁忙活跃的； 寒冷而清新的
detailed_translations.english: quick and full of energy

name: brief
trans: 简短的，简洁的 (adj.), 概述 (noun)

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

sentences.english: a feature that allows you to browse your hard drive and choose the graphic you want to display
sentences.chinese: 让你可以浏览硬盘驱动器选择自己想要显示的图像的一个功能

sentences.english: ...a browse around the shops.
sentences.chinese: …在商店的一番闲逛。

detailed_translations.english: to look through the pages of a book, magazine etc without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts
Browse is also a noun

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

sentences.english: He was breathing only with the aid of a ventilator.
sentences.chinese: 他只有靠呼吸器呼吸。

sentences.english: first aid
sentences.chinese: 急救；急救护理

detailed_translations.english: help that you need to do a particular thing

sentences.english: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛举枪瞄准，但是没有射击。

sentences.english: My criticism wasn't aimed at you.
sentences.chinese: 我的批评不是针对你的。

sentences.english: They are aiming to reduce unemployment by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 他们正力求使失业人数下降50%。

detailed_translations.english: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: alien
trans: 外星人，外国人 (noun), 外来的 (adj.)

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: ...the introduction of legislation to compel cyclists to wear a helmet.
sentences.chinese: …强制骑车人戴头盔的法律的引入。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something

sentences.english: the government’s promise to compensate victims of the flood
sentences.chinese: 政府对水灾灾民给予补偿的许诺

sentences.english: The firm will compensate workers for their loss of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 公司将补偿工人的收入损失。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone money because they have suffered injury, loss, or damage

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件是由卫生部汇编的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编译；编制；编辑；[图情] 汇编
detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

sentences.english: Students must complete the course.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须学完这门课程。

sentences.english: The building took two years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼花了两年时间才完工。

sentences.english: The darkness was almost complete.
sentences.chinese: 几乎是漆黑一片。

sentences.english: a complete stranger
sentences.chinese: 一个完全陌生的人

detailed_translations.english: to finish doing or making something, especially when it has taken a long time
used to emphasize that a quality or situation is as great as it could possibly be

name: complex
trans: 复杂的，复合的 (adj.), 组合体 (noun)

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.

name: grave
trans: 严肃的，庄重的 (adj.), 坟墓 (noun)

to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

sentences.english: the force of gravity

sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

sentences.english: ...grease-stained hands.
sentences.chinese: …沾满了油渍的手。

sentences.english: I greased front and rear hubs and adjusted the brakes.
sentences.chinese: 我把前后轮轴都加了润滑油并调试了刹车。

detailed_translations.english: a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil
If you grease a part of a car, machine, or device, you put grease on it in order to make it work smoothly

sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: medical research
sentences.chinese: 医学研究

sentences.english: medical staff

sentences.english: a medical student
sentences.chinese: 医科学生

sentences.english: a patient’s medical history
sentences.chinese: 患者的病史

sentences.chinese: 内科或外科疗法

detailed_translations.english: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury

sentences.english: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
sentences.chinese: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。

sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.chinese: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。

sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.chinese: 浴缸塞子

sentences.chinese: 尽管他已经74岁高龄，但身体依然很健壮，是爱达荷州博伊西商界中最老的水管工。

sentences.chinese: 即便没有高中文凭，一个黑人只要有求职意愿，他仍可能找到工作，并且水管工和电缆维修员这类体力活，薪酬还挺不错。

sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another

sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.chinese: 他给她倒了一杯，然后将自己的杯子斟满。

sentences.chinese: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.chinese: 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。

sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

sentences.english: a book on modern English usage
sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

sentences.english: It is a matter of the utmost urgency to find out what has happened to these people.
sentences.chinese: 当务之急是弄清楚这些人出了什么事。

sentences.chinese: 医护人员竭尽全力挽救那位病人的生命。

sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

sentences.chinese: 这是一笔意料之财呢，还是你本来就知道会有的？

sentences.chinese: 那头猪尖叫着站起来，飞快地跑开了。

detailed_translations.english: a screw with a flat head and no point, for fastening things together

detailed_translations.english: to lock a door or window by sliding a bolt across

detailed_translations.chinese: 突然地；像箭似地；直立地
detailed_translations.english: If a person or animal bolts, they suddenly start to run very fast, often because something has frightened them

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

sentences.english: The bomb went off at 9.30 in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹在早上9点半爆炸。

sentences.english: Enemy planes dropped over 200 bombs during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 袭击中敌机投下了两百多枚炸弹。

sentences.english: He was killed in a bomb explosion.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次炸弹爆炸中身亡。

sentences.english: The town was heavily bombed in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇在第二次世界大战中遭到猛烈轰炸。

detailed_translations.english: a weapon made of material that will explode

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

sentences.english: The X-ray showed that the bone was broken in two places.
sentences.chinese: X光检查显示有两处骨折。

sentences.english: Amelia had inherited her mother’s good bone structure.
sentences.chinese: 阿梅莉亚遗传了母亲的优美骨架。

detailed_translations.english: one of the hard parts that together form the frame of a human, animal, or fish body

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces

sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

trans: 精力充沛的，充满活力的 (adj.)

sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .

detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

sentences.english: The other hotels are all full.
sentences.chinese: 其他的宾馆均已客满。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign

sentences.english: a sign on the door

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning

sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.chinese: 简化税制的尝试

sentences.chinese: 我和约翰聊到凌晨才睡。

sentences.chinese: 赫尔穆特•科尔，德国前总理

sentences.chinese: 一根橡皮带

sentences.chinese: 他滑倒了，严重挫伤了一只胳膊肘。

sentences.chinese: 侍者们托着一盘盘的意大利面食在拥挤的餐桌间自如穿行。

sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸
