sentences.chinese: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。

sentences.english: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟笼养成功。

detailed_translations.english: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

sentences.english: The weather became warmer.
sentences.chinese: 天气变暖和了。

sentences.english: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.english: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。

sentences.english: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
sentences.chinese: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

sentences.english: When did you first want to become a teacher?
sentences.chinese: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

detailed_translations.english: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

sentences.english: He flung the box into the river.
sentences.chinese: 他把盒子扔进河里。

sentences.english: People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
sentences.chinese: 民众欢呼着把帽子抛向空中。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

sentences.english: Support for Mr Thompson is growing.
sentences.chinese: 汤普森先生的支持率在上升。

sentences.english: a tree which will grow well in most types of soil
sentences.chinese: 在大部分土壤里都能生长得很好的一种树

detailed_translations.english: to become bigger, taller etc over a period of time in the process of becoming an adult

sentences.english: Before you know it, the children will be grown-up and leaving home.
sentences.chinese: 转眼之间，孩子们就会长大成人离家而去。

sentences.english: I’ve got two grown-up sons.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个已经成年的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成长的； 成熟的； 成人的
detailed_translations.english: fully developed as an adult
an adult – used by or to children

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

sentences.english: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.english: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give a particular quality to something

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

sentences.english: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

sentences.english: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
sentences.chinese: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。

sentences.english: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
sentences.chinese: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部，接受了紧急手术。

detailed_translations.english: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

sentences.english: She has reason to feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她有理由感到内疚。

sentences.english: the human power of reason
sentences.chinese: 人类的理性

sentences.english: They reasoned that other businesses would soon copy the idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们推断其他企业也会很快仿效这个点子。

detailed_translations.english: why something happens, or why someone does something
to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

sentences.english: There was only one girl serving customers .
sentences.chinese: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 招待，供应；为…服务；对…有用；可作…用
detailed_translations.english: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
the action in a game such as tennis or  volleyball  when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

sentences.english: Many young girls became domestic servants .
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻姑娘成了家仆。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially in the past, who was paid to clean someone’s house, cook for them, answer the door etc, and who often lived in the house

sentences.english: the health service
sentences.chinese: 医疗保健服务

sentences.english: the postal service
sentences.chinese: 邮政服务

sentences.english: the police service
sentences.chinese: 警察部门

sentences.english: the prison service
sentences.chinese: 监狱系统

sentences.english: Workers in the emergency services (= the police, hospital, and the fire service ) are forbidden from striking.
sentences.chinese: 紧急服务机构的工作人员是禁止罢工的。

sentences.english: There has been a decline in public services in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来公共服务减少了。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["the police, hospitals, fire service, and organizations that provide basic things such as water, gas, or electricity"],"COLLOINEXA":["the essential services"]}
sentences.chinese: 基础服务部门

detailed_translations.english: the official system for providing something, especially something that everyone in a country needs to have, or the official organization that provides it

detailed_translations.chinese: 服务性的；耐用的；服现役的

detailed_translations.english: if someone services a machine or vehicle, they examine it and do what is needed to keep it working well

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

sentences.english: The team’s hopes of playing in Europe suffered a setback last night.
sentences.chinese: 球队赴欧洲参加比赛的希望昨晚遇到了阻碍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫折， 倒退， 失败
detailed_translations.english: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

sentences.english: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我在许多地方教过孩子，主要是在中学。

sentences.english: The heating system was already on its highest setting.
sentences.chinese: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

sentences.english: I have several suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个建议。

sentences.english: I have several methods.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个方法。

sentences.english: I have several reasons to support my view.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个理由来支持我的观点。

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

sentences.english: What shape is the table?
sentences.chinese: 那张桌子是什么形状的？

sentences.english: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

sentences.english: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
sentences.chinese: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

sentences.english: The plants grow in every shape and size .
sentences.chinese: 这些植物有各种形状，各种大小。

sentences.english: The children cut out shapes (= squares, triangles etc ) from the piece of cardboard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

detailed_translations.english: the form that something has, for example round, square,  triangular  etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
detailed_translations.english: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

sentences.english: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

sentences.english: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentences.chinese: 不要过桥，而是向左急转下到纤道上去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
detailed_translations.english: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sharp is also an adverb

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

sentences.english: In March 1889, she became the first British sovereign to set foot on Spanish soil.
sentences.chinese: 1889年3月，她成为首位踏上西班牙国土的英国君主。

sentences.english: a sovereign ruler
sentences.chinese: 最高统治者

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen
having the highest power in a country

sentences.english: Sow the seeds in late March.
sentences.chinese: 三月底播种。

detailed_translations.english: to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground
a fully grown female pig

sentences.english: Church bells tolled and black flags fluttered.
sentences.chinese: 教堂丧钟敲响了，黑旗飘动着。

detailed_translations.english: if a large bell tolls, or if you toll it, it keeps ringing slowly, especially to show that someone has died

detailed_translations.chinese: 过路费，过桥费；伤亡人数，损失
detailed_translations.english: the number of people killed or injured in a particular accident, by a particular illness etc

sentences.english: Her tone was sharp with anger.
sentences.chinese: 她很气愤，语气尖刻。

sentences.english: It was obvious from her tone of voice that she didn’t like me.
sentences.chinese: 从她的语气明显听得出来她不喜欢我。

detailed_translations.english: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

sentences.english: The environment is a popular topic these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今环境是一个热门话题。

sentences.english: The main topic for discussion will be the proposed new supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 讨论的主要议题是拟建中的超级市场。

sentences.english: a wide range of topics
sentences.chinese: 广泛的话题

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目， 论题， 话题
detailed_translations.english: a subject that people talk or write about

sentences.english: Hugh’s jacket was old and shabby.
sentences.chinese: 休的夹克衫又旧又破。

sentences.english: a shabby little restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家肮脏的小餐馆

sentences.english: a shabby tramp
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛的流浪汉

detailed_translations.english: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

sentences.english: a drive shaft
sentences.chinese: 驱动轴

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍杆；[机] 轴；箭杆；杆状物
detailed_translations.english: an  arrow

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

sentences.english: a shallow river
sentences.chinese: 浅河

sentences.english: The lake is quite shallow.
sentences.chinese: 这湖很浅。

sentences.english: the shallow end of the pool
sentences.chinese: 游泳池的浅水区

sentences.english: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

sentences.english: What kind of shampoo do you use?
sentences.chinese: 你用的是哪种洗发水？

sentences.english: a bottle of shampoo
sentences.chinese: 一瓶香波

detailed_translations.english: a liquid soap for washing your hair
to wash something with shampoo

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

sentences.english: He hadn’t shaved for days.
sentences.chinese: 他已经好几天没刮脸了。

sentences.english: Brian had cut himself shaving .
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩刮胡子时割破了脸。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off hair very close to the skin, especially from the face, using a  razor

sentences.english: Though shorn of some of its powers, the party remains in control.
sentences.chinese: 虽然被削去了一些权力，该党仍然掌握着控制权。

sentences.english: Trim the shrubs with shears.
sentences.chinese: 用大剪刀修剪这些灌木。

detailed_translations.english: to cut the wool off a sheep
A pair of shears is a garden tool like a very large pair of scissors. Shears are used especially for cutting hedges.

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

sentences.english: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely afraid

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

sentences.english: This cloth has a silky texture.
sentences.chinese: 这种布具有丝的质地。

sentences.english: What is the texture of your experience?
sentences.chinese: 这次经历的实质是什么？

sentences.english: Those jeans need a good wash (= a thorough wash ).
sentences.chinese: 那条牛仔裤要好好洗一洗了。

sentences.english: I’ll just have a quick wash before we go out.
sentences.chinese: 我很快洗个澡，然后我们就出门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗涤；洗的衣服；化妆水；冲积物
detailed_translations.english: an act of cleaning something using soap and water
to clean something using water and a type of soap

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

sentences.english: Do you mind if I watch?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我看着吗？

sentences.english: We sat and watched the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐下来看日落。

sentences.english: Ruth could not bear to watch her parents arguing.
sentences.chinese: 露丝看不得父母争吵。

sentences.english: Most parents don’t know what their kids are watching on TV.
sentences.chinese: 大多数父母不知道自己的孩子都在看什么电视节目。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a period of time, paying attention to what is happening
a small clock that you wear on your wrist or keep in your pocket

sentences.english: He kept his gaze fixed on the car ahead.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光一直盯着前面的那辆汽车。

sentences.english: We could see the lights of Las Vegas up ahead .
sentences.chinese: 我们能看到前方拉斯维加斯的灯光。

sentences.english: Henry hurried on ahead.
sentences.chinese: 亨利赶紧跑到前面。

sentences.english: The party was planned weeks ahead.
sentences.chinese: 聚会提前几个星期就已筹划好了。

detailed_translations.english: further forward in space or time; in front

sentences.english: The two chief function of any air-conditioning system are the regulation of air temperature and humidity.
sentences.chinese: 任何空气调节系统的两大主要功能，就是调节空气的温度和湿度。

sentences.english: The intention and Standard of the cleanout and disinfection operation of central air-conditioning system isdescribed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要介绍了中央空调系统中清洗、消毒工程的目的、要求、标准、规程、步骤、方法等。

sentences.english: In underground water source heating pump air-conditioning system of one guesthouse project, the heating pump unit does not always run at full load status.
sentences.chinese: 某宾馆工程地下水源热泵空调系统中，热泵机组在实际运行中不总处于满负荷运行状态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空调设备， 空调系统
detailed_translations.english: Air-conditioning is a method of providing buildings and vehicles with cool dry air

sentences.english: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的返回航程被推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: a plane or other vehicle that can fly

sentences.english: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat (=  seat next to the aisle  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

detailed_translations.english: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: It was a bad accident – they’re lucky to be alive.
sentences.chinese: 这是一宗严重事故——他们能活着实属幸运。

sentences.english: My grandparents are still alive .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母和外祖父母都还健在。

sentences.english: We stayed alive by eating berries.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃浆果活命。

sentences.english: He was kept alive on a life-support machine.
sentences.chinese: 他靠生命维持装置活着。

sentences.english: Apparently he’s alive and well and living in Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 看来他还健在，住在巴西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活着的；活泼的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: still living and not dead

sentences.english: The company engaged in a deliberate effort to cheat them out of their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司曾蓄意诈取他们的养老金。

detailed_translations.english: If someone cheats you out of something, they get it from you by behaving dishonestly
to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

sentences.english: Her heart was pounding in her chest.
sentences.chinese: 她的心在胸口怦怦直跳。

sentences.english: a hairy chest
sentences.chinese: 毛茸茸的胸部

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your body between your neck and your stomach

sentences.english: This meat’s so tough I can hardly chew it!
sentences.chinese: 这肉太老了，我几乎嚼不动！

detailed_translations.english: the act of biting something many times with your teeth
to bite food several times before swallowing it

sentences.english: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.chinese: 她和几位同事讨论了这个想法。

detailed_translations.english: someone you work with – used especially by professional people

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

sentences.english: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
sentences.chinese: 女性犯罪比男性少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯， 干； 使承诺； 把…托付给； 调拨…供使用， 拨出
detailed_translations.english: to do something wrong or illegal

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

sentences.english: ...the ultimate triumph of communism in the world.
sentences.chinese: …共产主义在全世界的最终胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a political system in which the government controls the production of all food and goods, and there is no privately owned property

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

sentences.english: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。

sentences.english: America’s deteriorating economy
sentences.chinese: 美国日渐恶化的经济

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

sentences.english: The blood tests prove that Vince is indeed the father.
sentences.chinese: 验血证明文斯确实是父亲。

sentences.english: ‘Would it help if you had an assistant?’ ‘It would indeed.’
sentences.chinese: “你要是有个助手，会有帮助吗？”“那是肯定的。

sentences.english: Most of the essays were very good indeed.
sentences.chinese: 这些文章大多数都非常好。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a statement or answer

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

sentences.english: She’s always very polite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是很有礼貌。

sentences.english: polite, well-behaved children
sentences.chinese: 懂礼貌、守规矩的孩子

sentences.english: a clear but polite request
sentences.chinese: 明确但客气的请求

sentences.english: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

sentences.english: His mother’s very sick.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲病得很重。

sentences.english: Maria can’t come in today because she’s sick.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚因为生病今天不能来了。

sentences.english: a sick child
sentences.chinese: 生病的孩子

sentences.english: a sick animal
sentences.chinese: 患病的动物

sentences.english: What will happen to the business if you fall sick (= become ill ) or die?
sentences.chinese: 假如你生病或是去世了，公司怎么办？

sentences.english: He took sick (= became ill ) and died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒后一周就去世了。

sentences.english: Pete’s at home in bed, sick as a dog (= very sick ) .
sentences.chinese: 皮特卧床在家，病得很重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶的；病态的；不舒服；渴望的；恶心的 ；生病的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or illness
people who are ill

sentences.english: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
sentences.chinese: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

sentences.english: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。

sentences.english: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。

sentences.english: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room (= the area that is furthest away from you ) .
sentences.chinese: 饭店里空空的，只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

sentences.english: He is in charge of the civilian side of the UN mission.
sentences.chinese: 他在联合国使团中负责平民方面的事务。

sentences.english: Frank sided with David against their mother.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克站在戴维一边反对妈妈。

sentences.english: Hannah slipped out through a side exit.
sentences.chinese: 汉娜从一个侧门溜了出去。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
in or on the side of something

sentences.english: A strong gust of wind blew the car sideways into the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风把汽车横着掀进了沟里。

sentences.english: Alfred shot him a sideways glance.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德斜着眼看了他一下。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards one side
Sideways is also an adjective

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

sentences.english: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
sentences.chinese: “唉，我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
an act or sound of sighing

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

sentences.english: She swam and sunbathed, went sightseeing and relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 她游泳，晒日光浴，观光，放松。

detailed_translations.english: when you visit famous or interesting places, especially as tourists

sentences.english: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
sentences.chinese: 沉默了片刻才有人回答。

sentences.english: ‘Silence in court!’ roared the judge.
sentences.chinese: “法庭上请保持肃静！”法官吼道。

sentences.english: The accused exercised his right to silence (= the legal right to choose to say nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 被告行使了沉默权。

sentences.english: She held up her hand to silence the children.
sentences.chinese: 她抬手示意孩子们安静下来。

detailed_translations.english: complete quiet because nobody is talking
to make someone stop talking, or stop something making a noise

sentences.english: The large house was silent and lonely.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大房子寂静荒凉。

sentences.english: At last the guns fell silent .
sentences.chinese: 枪声终于沉寂了下来。

sentences.english: Julie offered up a silent prayer that she would pass her exam.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉默默地祈祷，希望能通过这次考试。

sentences.english: Alan was silent.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦沉默不语。

detailed_translations.english: without any sound, or not making any sound

sentences.english: But the brittleness of silicon limits its uses.
sentences.chinese: 但是，硅的脆性也限制了其应用范围。

sentences.english: The company pioneered the use of the silicon chip.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司首先使用硅片。

sentences.english: They consist of silicon, sand and metal so there’s no any connection to dinosaurs … Besides, we may see corrosion on some of them.
sentences.chinese: 它们是由硅砂和金属构成的，和恐龙蛋没有任何关系……除此之外，我们还能看到它们上面的腐蚀的部分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that exists as a solid or as a powder and is used to make glass, bricks, and parts for computers. It is a chemical element: symbol Si

sentences.english: Stop asking silly questions.
sentences.chinese: 别再问傻问题了。

sentences.english: You made a lot of silly mistakes .
sentences.chinese: 你犯了许多愚蠢的错误。

sentences.english: I left my keys at home, which was a pretty silly thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 我干了件傻事，把钥匙落在家里了。

sentences.english: ‘Shall we go for a walk?’ ‘ Don’t be silly , it’s dark.’
sentences.chinese: “我们去散步吧？”“别犯傻了，天都黑了。”

detailed_translations.english: not sensible, or showing bad judgment

sentences.english: The silver spoon tarnished.
sentences.chinese: 银匙失去光泽了。

if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

sentences.chinese: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

sentences.chinese: 那件新款长礼服非常成功。

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.chinese: 桌子上有面包屑和糖粒。

sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.chinese: 萨姆现在身高和他姐姐差不多了。

sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

sentences.english: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
sentences.chinese: 这两条河在匹兹堡附近汇合。

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.chinese: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

name: double
trans: 双倍的，两倍的 (adj.), 双重的 (adj.)

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
