sentences.chinese: 排出隧道污浊空气的排气扇

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的
detailed_translations.english: very dirty

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害
detailed_translations.english: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
an action in a sport that is against the rules

sentences.english: It took the builders three weeks to lay the foundations .
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

sentences.english: The fountain wells its cold water.
sentences.chinese: 喷泉涌出清凉的泉水。

sentences.english: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

detailed_translations.english: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: fragrant flowers
sentences.chinese: 芳香的花朵

detailed_translations.english: having a pleasant smell

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

sentences.english: rooms decorated with wall paintings and mosaics
sentences.chinese: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间

sentences.english: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
sentences.chinese: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

detailed_translations.chinese: 摩西的；拼成的；嵌花式的

detailed_translations.english: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

name: curious
trans: 好奇的 (adj.) - 对事物感到兴趣

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: curiosity
trans: 好奇心 (n.) - 对未知的兴趣

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: current
trans: 当前的 (adj.) - 现在的；水流

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

sentences.english: Do you want me to cut the cake?
sentences.chinese: 要我切蛋糕吗？

sentences.english: They’re introducing CCTV cameras in an attempt to cut street crime in the area.
sentences.chinese: 为了减少该地区的街头犯罪，他们安装了闭路电视摄像机。

sentences.english: You need to cut the amount of fat and sugar in your diet.
sentences.chinese: 你需要减少饮食中脂肪和糖的摄入量。

sentences.english: Scientists are warning that unless carbon emissions are cut, we could be heading for an environmental catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 科学家警告说如果不减少碳排放量，我们可能会面临环境灾难。

sentences.english: Seven hundred jobs will be lost in order to cut costs and boost profits.
sentences.chinese: 为了降低成本，提高利润，将削减700个职位。

sentences.english: The major aviation companies need to cut prices if they are to compete with budget airlines.
sentences.chinese: 大航空公司如果想和廉价的航空公司竞争，就需要降低价格。

sentences.english: Staffing levels had already been cut to the bone (= reduced to the lowest level possible ) .
sentences.chinese: 人员配备已经削减到了最低限度。

detailed_translations.english: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

sentences.english: Learning is a cumulative process.
sentences.chinese: 学习是个逐渐积累的过程。

detailed_translations.english: increasing gradually as more of something is added or happens

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: awake
trans: 醒来 (v.) - 从睡眠中恢复意识

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: aware
trans: 意识到的 (adj.) - 明白了解

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: awkward
trans: 笨拙的 (adj.) - 不自然的行为

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: extreme
trans: 极端的 (adj.) - 极端的情况

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: invisible
trans: 看不见的 (adj.) - 不可察觉的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

sentences.english: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.english: He thought he had solved the puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

sentences.english: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
sentences.chinese: 令我不解的是，他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: something that is difficult to understand or explain
to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: role
trans: 角色 (n.) - 在剧中的身份

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

name: roll
trans: 滚动 (vi.) - 圆形物体移动

sentences.english: The ball rolled into the street.
sentences.chinese: 球滚到了街上。

sentences.english: There was silence as the cameras started to roll.
sentences.chinese: 摄影机开始转动，大家安静了下来。

detailed_translations.english: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

name: root
trans: 根 (n.) - 植物的基础部分

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: rule
trans: 规则 (n.) - 规定的行为准则

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

sentences.english: a 12-inch ruler
sentences.chinese: 一把12英寸的尺子

detailed_translations.chinese: 尺；统治者；[测] 划线板，划线的人
detailed_translations.english: someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area

sentences.english: What is your surname?
sentences.chinese: 你姓什么?

sentences.english: Your surname may be derived from a place, such as Lancaster, for example, or an occupation, such as Weaver, but this is not necessarily of relevance to your family history.
sentences.chinese: 或许，你的姓氏来源于一个地方名，例如兰开斯特，或者来源于职业，例如编织工。 但是，这并不能中肯地说出你家族的历史。

detailed_translations.english: the name that you share with your parents, or often with your husband if you are a married woman, and which in English comes at the end of your full name

name: surpass
trans: 超越 (vt.) - 达到更高的水平

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: surprise
trans: 惊讶 (n.) - 出乎意料的事情

sentences.english: His strange question surprised her.
sentences.chinese: 他那奇怪的问题令她感到意外。

sentences.english: I didn’t know you two knew each other. Mind you, it doesn’t surprise me .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你们俩认识。 尽管如此，我并不感到意外。

sentences.english: What surprised me most was that she didn’t seem to care.
sentences.chinese: 最令我感到意外的是，她好像毫不在乎。

sentences.english: The man had a look of surprise on his face.
sentences.chinese: 那人脸上一副惊讶的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使诧异,使惊异,使感到意外
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel surprised
the feeling you have when something unexpected or unusual happens

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

sentences.english: electronic surveillance equipment
sentences.chinese: 电子监控设备

detailed_translations.english: when the police, army etc watch a person or place carefully because they may be connected with criminal activities

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: susceptible
trans: 易受影响的 (adj.) - 容易受到影响

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: suspicious
trans: 可疑的 (adj.) - 值得怀疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

very good

name: artery
trans: 动脉 (n.) - 输送血液的血管

sentences.english: Of, like, or in an artery or arteries.
sentences.chinese: 动脉的动脉的，似动脉的，或在动脉里的。

sentences.chinese: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

sentences.english: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.chinese: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

trans: 清晰表达 (v.) - 清楚地说出

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

name: artistic
trans: 艺术的 (adj.) - 与艺术相关的

sentences.chinese: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值，人们褒贬不一。

sentences.chinese: 我有件礼物送给你。

sentences.chinese: 她前额上的皱纹

sentences.chinese: 哈里松开了领带。

detailed_translations.english: a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land
a man in  medieval  Europe who was very powerful and owned a lot of land

sentences.english: Now and then they heard the roar of a heavy lorry.
sentences.chinese: 他们不时听见一辆重型卡车的轰响声。

detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle for carrying heavy goods

sentences.chinese: 你真的认为彩票中奖会带给你幸福吗？

detailed_translations.english: a game used to make money for a state or a  charity  in which people buy tickets with a series of numbers on them. If their number is picked by chance, they win money or a prize.

detailed_translations.english: a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure
If you moan, you make a low sound, usually because you are unhappy or in pain

name: mob

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

sentences.chinese: 从一个模块转换到另一个模块。

sentences.english: In this step, you create a new module for the selector.
sentences.chinese: 在此步骤中，您将为选择器创建一个新的模块。

sentences.english: You then iterate the modules that depended on you and remove this module from their lists.
sentences.chinese: 然后迭代具有依赖性的模块，并将这个模块从这些列表中删除。

sentences.english: He’ll phone on some pretext or other.
sentences.chinese: 他会以这样或那样的理由打电话的。

detailed_translations.english: a false reason given for an action, in order to hide the real reason

sentences.english: a pretty little girl

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.chinese: 有些人认为这场演讲只是华而不实的政治空谈。

sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: rib
trans: 肋骨 (n.) - 保护胸腔的骨头

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital with a broken arm and ribs.
sentences.chinese: 她胳膊和肋骨断了，被送进医院。

sentences.english: He was punched and kicked in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: 他的肋部遭到拳打脚踢。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest
to furnish or support with a rib or ribs

name: ribbon
trans: 丝带 (n.) - 细长柔软的带子

sentences.english: little girls with ribbons in their hair
sentences.chinese: 头发上系着丝带的小姑娘们

sentences.english: a bundle of letters tied with pale blue ribbon
sentences.chinese: 一捆用淡蓝色丝带扎好的信

sentences.english: The ribbon was cut and the new station was officially open.
sentences.chinese: 剪彩后，新车站正式开始运营。

detailed_translations.chinese: 带；缎带；（勋章等的）绶带；带状物；勋表
detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…撕成条带；用缎带装饰

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

sentences.english: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

detailed_translations.english: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

name: ridiculous
trans: 荒谬的 (adj.) - 没有意义的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

sentences.english: a rigorous analysis of defence needs
sentences.chinese: 对国防需求的缜密分析

sentences.english: the rigorous standards required by the college
sentences.chinese: 大学规定的严格标准

detailed_translations.english: careful, thorough, and exact

name: rim
trans: 边缘 (n.) - 物体周围的部分

sentences.english: She looked at him over the rim of her glass.
sentences.chinese: 她沿玻璃杯口看着他。

detailed_translations.english: the outside edge of something circular
to be around the edge of something

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

sentences.english: I want to get off at the next station.
sentences.chinese: 我要在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Grand Central Station
sentences.chinese: 中央火车站

sentences.english: Is there a waiting room in the station?
sentences.chinese: 车站里有候车室吗？

sentences.english: the city bus station
sentences.chinese: 市内公共汽车站

detailed_translations.english: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty

sentences.english: How did you manage to drive into a stationary vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么开车的，竟会撞上一辆停着的车子？

detailed_translations.chinese: 固定的， 静止不动的
detailed_translations.english: standing still instead of moving

sentences.english: a letter on hotel stationery
sentences.chinese: 用酒店信纸写的信

sentences.english: envelopes and other office stationery
sentences.chinese: 信封及其他办公文具

detailed_translations.english: paper for writing letters, usually with matching envelopes

sentences.english: ...a steak sizzling on the grill.
sentences.chinese: …一块儿在烤架上滋滋作响的牛排。

detailed_translations.english: good quality beef, or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat

name: steam
trans: 蒸汽 (n.) - 加热产生的水汽

sentences.english: Steam rose from the hot tub.
sentences.chinese: 水蒸气从热腾腾的浴缸里升起。

detailed_translations.english: the hot mist that water produces when it is boiled
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

name: stereotype
trans: 刻板印象 (n.) - 固定看法

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: steward
trans: 服务员 (n.) - 提供服务的人

sentences.english: race stewards
sentences.chinese: 比赛组织者

detailed_translations.chinese: 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事
detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

sentences.english: Every transistor has at least three electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.english: The transistor became the basis of a new invention called the "computer" which I suspect those of you reading this may be familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

sentences.english: baggage that is lost or damaged in transit
sentences.chinese: 在运输过程中丢失或损坏的行李

sentences.english: transit by air or sea
sentences.chinese: 空运或海运

detailed_translations.english: the process of moving goods or people from one place to another

name: transition
trans: 过渡 (n.) - 由一种状态变为另一种

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

sentences.english: Poetry doesn’t usually translate well.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌通常都译不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
detailed_translations.english: to change written or spoken words into another language

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

sentences.english: ...the development of better user interfaces.
sentences.chinese: …更好用户界面的开发。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program

detailed_translations.chinese: （使通过界面或接口）接合，连接；[计算机]使联系
detailed_translations.english: if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

sentences.english: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.chinese: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明; 设计; 设法；造成
detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

sentences.english: a telephone conversation
sentences.chinese: 电话交谈

sentences.english: Children quickly get bored by adult conversation.
sentences.chinese: 儿童对成年人的谈话很快就会厌倦。

sentences.english: They had a short conversation in German and seemed to be disagreeing about something.
sentences.chinese: 他们用德语说了一会儿，好像对什么事有分歧。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to carry on a conversation with all this noise in the background.
sentences.chinese: 在这么喧闹的环境中进行谈话是不可能的。

sentences.english: ‘Did you have a good journey?’ he said, trying to make conversation .
sentences.chinese: “你旅途愉快吗？”他问道，试图找话谈。

sentences.english: He was silent, no matter how hard Sofia tried to engage him in conversation .
sentences.chinese: 无论索菲娅怎么引他说话，他就是一声不吭。

sentences.english: After a while, the conversation turned to a friend’s coming wedding.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，话题就转到一个朋友即将举行的婚礼上去了。

sentences.english: They were deep in conversation , relaxed and smiling.
sentences.chinese: 他们谈得很投入，很放松，脸上带着微笑。

sentences.english: He could hear snatches of conversation from across the room.
sentences.chinese: 他从房间对面听得到零星的对话。

detailed_translations.english: an informal talk in which people exchange news, feelings, and thoughts

sentences.english: American consumers prefer white eggs; conversely, British buyers like brown eggs.
sentences.chinese: 美国的消费者喜欢白色的鸡蛋，而英国的消费者却相反，他们喜欢棕色的鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: used when one situation is the opposite of another

sentences.english: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.
sentences.chinese: …把废弃的铁路改变成自行车道。

detailed_translations.english: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: a convicted murderer
sentences.chinese: 已定罪的谋杀犯

sentences.english: an escaped convict
sentences.chinese: 越狱犯

detailed_translations.english: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court
someone who has been proved to be guilty of a crime and sent to prison

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: twist
trans: 扭曲 (vt./n.) - 改变方向或形状；使困惑

sentences.english: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手开始拧她拎着的那个包的拎柄。

sentences.english: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了，嘴巴慢慢一歪，带着嘲笑的意味。

detailed_translations.english: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape
a twisting action or movement

name: trivial
trans: 琐碎的 (adj.) - 不重要的，无关紧要的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: try
trans: 尝试 (vt.) - 努力做某事；试用

sentences.english: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: tumble
trans: 翻滚 (vi.) - 快速滚动或翻转

sentences.english: Oil prices have tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 石油价格猛跌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌倒，摔下，滚下；翻滚；暴跌；不由自主地卷入
detailed_translations.english: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement
a fall, especially from a high place or level

name: turbulent
trans: 动荡的 (adj.) - 混乱不安的，波动剧烈的

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: turn
trans: 转动 (vt./vi.) - 转动；改变方向

sentences.english: Ricky turned and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.english: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ) , and stomped out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换
detailed_translations.english: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

name: turnover
trans: 周转率 (n.) - 更换速度；营业额

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

name: typical
trans: 典型的 (adj.) - 典型代表性的

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: voluntary
trans: 自愿的 (adj.) - 自愿参与的

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: volunteer
trans: 志愿者 (n.) - 自愿提供服务的人

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: vote
trans: 投票 (n./vt.) - 投赞成票或反对票

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

name: vulgar
trans: 粗俗的 (adj.) - 味道或行为低劣

sentences.english: vulgar behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗俗的行为

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

name: vulnerable
trans: 脆弱的 (adj.) - 容易受到攻击或伤害

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: author
trans: 作者 (n.) - 写作作品的人

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

name: authority
trans: 权威 (n.) - 权威性；权力机构

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

sentences.english: a nursing auxiliary
sentences.chinese: 护理辅助人员

detailed_translations.chinese: 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构
detailed_translations.english: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

sentences.english: Guests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.
sentences.chinese: 客人们应可以随意使用你们的设施。

sentences.english: His efforts were to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 他的努力是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: to be helpful or useful to sb

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: critical
trans: 批评的 (adj.) - 关键的；挑剔的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: criticism
trans: 批评 (n.) - 对缺点或错误的指摘

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: crucial
trans: 至关重要的 (adj.) - 极其重要的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: culminate
trans: 达到高潮 (vi.) - 结束于最高点

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: culprit
trans: 罪魁祸首 (n.) - 犯罪的主要人物

sentences.english: Police finally managed to catch the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 警察终于抓住了罪犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯人，罪犯；被控犯罪的人
detailed_translations.english: the person who is guilty of a crime or doing something wrong

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: culture
trans: 文化 (n.) - 社会生活方式

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

sentences.english: a dual system of education
sentences.chinese: 二元[双元]教育体系

detailed_translations.english: having two of something or two parts

name: dubious
trans: 可疑的 (adj.) - 值得怀疑的

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

name: due
trans: 应得的 (adj.) - 应该得到的

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: durable
trans: 耐用的 (adj.) - 经久耐用的

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: duration
trans: 持续时间 (n.) - 时间长度

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

sentences.english: I promise I will do my duty .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会尽到我的责任。

sentences.english: We feel it is our duty to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我们感到帮助她是我们的责任。

sentences.english: Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
sentences.chinese: 地方当局有责任保持街道整洁。

sentences.english: You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
sentences.chinese: 你对你丈夫和孩子负有责任。

sentences.english: She has a strong sense of moral duty .
sentences.chinese: 她的道德责任感很强。

sentences.english: Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的职责包括清洗汽车。

sentences.english: the duty on cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 香烟税

detailed_translations.english: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right

name: dynamic
trans: 动态的 (adj.) - 活跃变化的

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: extinct
trans: 灭绝的 (adj.) - 消失不再存在的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

sentences.english: Pete, are you going to make the introductions?
sentences.chinese: 皮特，你来作一下介绍吧。

sentences.english: Our first contestant needs no introduction (= everyone already knows the person ).
sentences.chinese: 我们的第一位参赛者就不用介绍了。

sentences.english: the introduction of Buddhism to China nearly 2,000 years ago
sentences.chinese: 约2,000年前佛教传入中国

sentences.english: In the introduction, he explains why he wrote the book.
sentences.chinese: 在引言里，他解释了写这本书的原因。

detailed_translations.english: the act of formally telling two people each other’s names when they first meet

name: invest
trans: 投资 (vt.) - 出资购买股份

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: mysterious
trans: 神秘的 (adj.) - 难以理解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: mystery
trans: 谜团 (n.) - 无法解释的事物

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: noble
trans: 高贵的 (adj.) - 尊贵高尚的

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: normal
trans: 正常的 (adj.) - 符合常规的

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: normalization
trans: 规范化 (n.) - 使其标准化

sentences.english: The trend of half permanent enterprise management culture towards normalization direction.
sentences.chinese: 趋势三半永久企业的经营管理文化将朝正规化方向发展。

sentences.english: Our normalization is such that the curves in Fig . 3 can be regarded as probability distributions.
sentences.chinese: 我们的标准化处理使得图3中的曲线可以被看作概率分布曲线。

sentences.english: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。

sentences.english: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
sentences.chinese: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条，但又决定还是打电话给她。

sentences.english: The notes are at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 注解在书末。

detailed_translations.english: something that you write down to remind you of something

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: public
trans: 公众的 (adj.) - 属于全体人民的

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: publication
trans: 出版物 (n.) - 发表的作品

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

sentences.english: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 会谈之前做了大量的宣传。

sentences.english: ...government publicity campaigns.
sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

detailed_translations.english: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: resultant
trans: 结果的 (adj.) - 导致的结果

sentences.english: She is still trying to get over the attack and the resultant injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她仍在努力从袭击以及由此造成的伤害中恢复过来。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing because of something

name: resume
trans: 简历 (n.) - 工作经历记录

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

sentences.english: a friendly smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

sentences.english: I’ve found a great pub – good beer and a friendly atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 我找到了一家很棒的酒馆——啤酒好，氛围也亲切。

sentences.chinese: 与AC米兰队的友谊赛

sentences.chinese: 她与姑母的亲密友谊

sentences.chinese: 一生的友谊

sentences.english: The two boys formed a deep and lasting friendship .
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩子建立了深厚持久的友谊。

sentences.english: I could always rely on Gary for friendship and support.
sentences.chinese: 我总是可以依靠加里的友情和支持。

sentences.chinese: 你这样不声不响地过来，吓了我一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

sentences.chinese: 别站得那么靠边！你要把我吓坏了。

sentences.chinese: 她被他眼中的怒火吓住了。

sentences.chinese: 电脑过去让我感到害怕，但现在不了。

sentences.chinese: 一头棕色直发、留着刘海的高个子女孩

sentences.english: The monarchists are a small fringe group who quarrel fiercely among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 君主制拥护者们是个边缘性小团体，内部争吵激烈。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead

sentences.english: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

detailed_translations.english: the border of a country

detailed_translations.english: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).

sentences.chinese: 我们看见离岸边大约一英里的地方有一艘船。

sentences.chinese: 德国在相对较短的时间里取得了非凡的经济成就。

sentences.chinese: 短短的几个星期里，阳光照耀，田野变成了一片金黄。

sentences.chinese: 用不着大声喊叫！我听得见！

sentences.english: What is the worst possible thing that can happen?
sentences.chinese: 最糟可能会发生什么事？

sentences.english: Aid is being sent to areas that have been worst affected by the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 援助物资正在送往受地震影响最严重的地区。

detailed_translations.english: worse than anything or anyone else
most badly

sentences.english: Other youngsters are not so lucky.
sentences.chinese: 其他的年轻人没有这么幸运。

detailed_translations.english: a child or young person
